Reviews.Title: Great even without cable!
Reviews.Author: Dame Droiture
Reviews.Content: I currently do not have cable, nor plan to get it soon, but I got this TV anyway because I wanted something larger.  Due to the 2009 broadcasting changes, I wasn't going to get another analog set.  It's a great TV -- I get all the channels I used to have on my old one via the antenna, but MUCH clearer.  One of my favorite things about this set is that it has the pin connector to work as a computer monitor.  If you have very little space and want a product that can multi-task, this is a great thing.

Reviews.Title: GREAT LITTLE BEAUTY
Reviews.Author: so very bored
Reviews.Content: I originally was going to buy a bigger screen.  However, after standing back about 15 feet, I noticed the picture was so vivid, and it didn't diminish.  For anyone with a smaller living room, it's great.  I'm completely satisfied.  DVD was easy to hook up too.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: M. Berry
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. I bought it primarily for playing video games, and it doesn't dissapoint. My Xbox 360 looks crystal clear and beautiful running 720p. The TV can run 1080i, but I like 720p better. The menu is easy to use, and it doesn't have any complexities. The only problem I have with it is that when I play PS2 or PS1 games, the graphics are a bit choppy, due to the system's inability for HD games. The text is hard to read in those instances, but the graphics are easy to get over. Otherwise, this is a perfect TV.

Reviews.Title: Avoid-Poor Warranty-Not worth the Money
Reviews.Author: Majer Oliver Younger
Reviews.Content: I've had this set for less than one year and it is already failing. The set has difficulty starting, looses channels and turns itself off repeatedly. The picture completely fails and the unit screeches and blacks out. The warranty is exceedingly **POOR**. One year on parts, however, when I contacted Magnavox customer support I was told there is no repair service on this model, but they would replace with a new unit for an additional $275.00!!!!(No Warranty??). Avoid this item completely!

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV for the money.
Reviews.Author: Clayton Henry
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my home office so I could play videogames on my PS3 during my breaks.  When using an HDMI cable the games and Blu-ray movies are gorgeous!  If you are patient and take the time to adjust the picture and resolutions just right, you will get more than your money's worth from this TV.  I'm not sure why it only mentions 720p, because it plays Blu-ray movies (and certain videogames) at 1080p.Be warned that regular analog TV will look much worse.  And so will SD DVDs.  In the meantime, using an HDMI cable helps clean up regular DVDs a great deal.If you are into "next gen" gaming, HD movies, and are on a budget, this TV is a great choice.Update Jan '09:  After one year this TV has stopped working.  ONE YEAR!  That stinks no matter the price!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this item
Reviews.Author: C. gibson
Reviews.Content: I bought the Magnavox 19MF337B TV. While the picture quality is good, the unit went bad in 11 months of normal use. It makes a loud popping noise and then shuts down completely. Apparently there are capacitors that go bad in this model, and it dies. I have read the same complaint many places on the web about this model. Since your warranty with Maganavox is only good for 90 days, you are out of luck. Stay away from Magnavox/Phillips TVs. You're wasting your money.

Reviews.Title: Bought less than a year ago and now will not turn on
Reviews.Author: M Shields
Reviews.Content: Our TV just gave out after owning it for less than a year. The power button is lit red but wil not advance. The TV will not go beyond a black screen. I called customer service to be told, for a fee of $274.62 plus tax they will  replace it. I can buy the same tv on the web for the $240 range!Not good customer care or product.

Reviews.Title: Buyers Beware
Reviews.Author: S. MCCABE
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV almost 2 years ago.  It had worked great, up until about a week ago.  Now, we have static for the first 5 minutes after we turn the TV on, until it warms up.  And the picture has started flashing in & out occasionally.  I would expect a TV to last for more than 2 years.  We will not be buying another Philips/Magnavox LCD TV.

Reviews.Title: WARNING!!! Do not buy this TV!
Reviews.Author: S. O'Toole
Reviews.Content: We purchased this television from Sams Club in Dec. 07, it worked well until 14 months later.  It has the same problems as reported on many of these reviews: turning of and on, screeching noises, crackling noises etc.  This TV is not usable which I find absolutely unacceptable for a television that was only 14 months old at the time!!!!  The customer service was even worse!  When I told them the problems my tv was having, they put me on hold and then came back to tell me that I was the only person who has reported these problems.  After reading these reviews that is apparently not a true statement! The representative gave me a service number to get my tv fixed.  When I called the given number they were located in Maryland, we live in Pennsylvania. She also gave me a number in Virginia.  When I called back they were unsympathetic and said the tv wasn't under warranty and my only option is to write a letter to the corporate office. This is my first and last Magnavox purchase!  Do not buy this television, unless you only want to use it for about a year!!!

Reviews.Title: it's fixable
Reviews.Author: Lewis or Clark
Reviews.Content: Somebody gave me a broken one of these and I fixed it easily.  If you know how to solder, you will be able to fix it.There are three capacitors on the main board that always go bad.Do a web search for the terms 19MF337B C112 C117 C118 and you will find instructions.Replace the bad caps with three EEUFR1C102 aka P14398, costing about $5 total.

Reviews.Title: BUYER BEWARE
Reviews.Author: Edwin V. Clarke "Tripp_PGH"
Reviews.Content: Two years after purchasing a 19" HDTV television it started acting-up.  It would make this HORRIBLE noise every time we turned it on... it would shut-off then turn on... then make the noise again and shut off... and repeat this for about 15 minutes until it would stop.  I sent the company a letter.  Two weeks later no reply.  I did a Google search and found hundreds and hundreds of unhappy customers.  See for yourself at [...]Yes, it is past the manufacturers warranty, but a company that makes a product that sells for anywhere between $300 and $3000 that doesn't last more than two years should 1) be ashamed and 2) be out of business.Do your homework and find a company that makes a decent TV.

Reviews.Title: Don't even think about buying!!
Reviews.Author: B. Hogan
Reviews.Content: Like others have stated, the tv is now a piece of garbage.  We had the tv for about a year and a half when it started screeching, then the picture would black out.  During this time you cannot control the tv, usually you need to unplug it and restart it.  It progressively got worse to the point where there is no longer any picture or sound.  Of course the warranty is short so it had run out before the problems started.  Unless you have $200 to waste, I would find something else.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy It!
Reviews.Author: J. Rysanek "Law Man"
Reviews.Content: I have had the same problems everyone else complains of: screeching sound (that scares the hell out of you), powering on then off. I read that it was a result of the power supply, so I ordered a new one ($44) and installed it, it still has the same problem.  The other part that has been recommended to change is a scaler board ($263) which costs almost as much as the TV did. This TV was great now it sucks...Hard.

Reviews.Title: short lasting HDTV for over $200!
Reviews.Author: H. Wong "harlinwong"
Reviews.Content: I had bought this item at SAM's Club in Sept. 2008. The TV started acting up near the end of April 2009. The TV ,when initially, turned on, would make a loud pop or a high pitch buzz and the screen would go black. After doing this 2-3 times back to back, the TV would warm up and finally work. I use this mainly as a TV, now I am using the screensaver on my computer to warm up the unit, so I can watch TV (Very inconvient). I am considering getting a 19" Vizio LCD.  I only wished that I had read the reviews prior to my purchase.  I am definantly staying away from ALL Phillips Magnavox products in the future FOREVER!

Reviews.Title: less than 9 months, picture tube going.....
Reviews.Author: traildancer
Reviews.Content: I bought this set dec 10. in the last 2 months we've noticed horizontal lines and shadows. I've checked everything according to cable lines. It is the TV set.  The service center admitted that this set does have a picture tube problem. they can fix it for $274.00.  I bought it originaly for about that price.  I'm really angry that it is dying so soon. All other TV's I've ever owned have lasted for many many years!  I really liked this set up till this problem.  In my opionion, less than one year for your money is not worth it!

Reviews.Title: Good picture, very annoying channel change
Reviews.Author: D. Phillips
Reviews.Content: This set has an annoying 'feature' that was so irritating we returned the set.As you change channels, a large grey status panel comes up, with the language, screen format & sound settings.  The panel stays on the screen for 4 seconds.This probably won't happen if you have this hooked up to a cable converter, but if you're pulling straight off antenna or cable, it makes channel surfing intolerable.The picture and sound were fine.

Reviews.Title: This is without a doubt the worst TV I have ever purchased.
Reviews.Author: C. Grilli "Carlouie33"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Magnavox TV about 2 years ago. In recent weeks, whenever the unit is turned on, there is a loud screach that sounds like a cross between chalk on a blackboard and enraged Harpies with PMS. Then the sound typically turns off, then the picture goes blank. Sometimes the unit turns itself off, only to turn back on, and sometimes remains off. This goes on for about 15 minutes, after which time, everything seems to be quite normal. Magnavox will not not take any responsibility for their woefully inadequate product, siting that the unit is no longer under their woefully inadequate 1 year warranty. I will NEVER buy a Magnavox product EVER AGAIN. I am completely dissatisfied.

Reviews.Title: Not fit for its purpose
Reviews.Author: Claire Wong
Reviews.Content: I got this TV as a gift about 18 months ago. It worked well initially and I was able to get good picture quality without cable connections. But it started acting up in the last 2 months....unable to start up without suffering the 5 to 10 minutes of high pitch buzzing and the continuous switching on and off of the set. Although it was located in the bedroom, the buzzing noise bothered everyone in the family including our dog. Extremely annoying. After reading all the very helpful comments of "fellow sufferers" on this review board, I have decided not to waste my time on trying to find a repair solution for it but to get rid of it. I used to think better of Phillips' quality.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Great Price
Reviews.Author: Gil Jimenez
Reviews.Content: I needed to replace a large beast of a 19" 4-year-old tv in the bedroom and through some research I came across this one. I found it for $299 and I went in to a store to check it out. It was hands down the best picture of about 12 models they had (all 19") and the best price also, by at least $50. Got it home, set it up, let the auto setup run for about 30 minutes while it scanned for channels, got some dinner, came back and wow! The built in ATSC tuner picked up about 13 analog channels and 37 HD... Over the air with the regular old rabbit-ear antennas! Can't wait to hook up the upscaling DVD player. Like I said, I use over the air signal, I don't have cable and I get great reception, with the exception of about 2 channels in High Def. Can't wait for Thursday to test this out watching Lost!

Reviews.Title: Avoid
Reviews.Author: K. Biegler
Reviews.Content: Agree with the others here have had this TV for a couple of years and in the last month or so started the screeching and turning on and off. Searching the internet reveals this isn't an uncommon occurence with this model and has to to do with one or ever multiple power supplies/capacitors and possibly on more than one board. Buyer beware it's more to repair the unit than to buy another TV so only buy this if you are prepared to throw it away in about a year.

Reviews.Title: FAULTY CONSTRUCTION
Reviews.Author: PYC
Reviews.Content: It's been about a year since I bought this TV and started having problems with it. I decided to do a little research online and lo and behold, almost EVERYONE else who bought this TV had the same exact problems. Like the others, the TV started to make loud popping noises like a capacitor makes when it explodes. The TV would then repeatedly shut it self off and on again. Don't be fooled by the picture quality, this TV will not last. It astounds me that companies actually sell products like this. I, for one, will never buy anything from Magnavox ever again.

Reviews.Title: Worst burn for a lemon TV in my 50 years as a TV buyer
Reviews.Author: Kenneth D. Reed
Reviews.Content: Bought this sorry, unreliable piece of junk and can't help but feel that I was suckered. Other reviews indicate that the problems I had with this TV (turning itself off and on at will, screeches at times) have been experienced by many others. Inferior product and no recourse! The P.R.O.C. (China) cannot be trusted to put out quality products. They also cannot be trusted to atone for their failures. NO MORE CHINESE ELECTRONICS WILL BE PURCHASED BY THIS REVIEWER.......I'm retired and cannot afford to waste $300-$400 on junk.

Reviews.Title: Read Company Feedback first.....before you get burned.
Reviews.Author: Brian K. Cline
Reviews.Content: This review is for "bigadealz"...."Don't bother, look elsewhere. Better customer service from a garage sale attendent. Since I have to give atlease I star to document." TV would have been great if received as ordered.

Reviews.Title: OK for its short life
Reviews.Author: Melissa J. Hetrick "jimmy8"
Reviews.Content: This TV is fine for an extra TV.  WHILE IT WORKED it had OK picture, color, controls, volume etc.  Not sure how long I've owned it..2 years maybe.  Without warning and while watching, the TV made a load, startling noise, the screen went black, silence....dead.  Pretty short life for a few hundred buck occasional use TV.  Certainly don't make you want to repurchase or recommend Magnavox.

Reviews.Title: Another Dissatified User
Reviews.Author: jona
Reviews.Content: I'll add my 2 cents to these reviews because that is about all the unit is worth now - Christmax gift in 2009; worked great until about three months ago...now I have to turn it on and off dozens of times just to get the picture and/or sound to stablize, all while putting up with that terrible screeching noise....gads!  Magnavox used to be a great firm, that stood behind their products because they were that good, now they don't because their products are all that BAD!!!!!

Reviews.Title: One enormous piece of poo...
Reviews.Author: C. Williamson
Reviews.Content: I guess I'm luckier than most owners, since I still get a picture, though it degrades every week. The first problem, and a continuing one, is sound. For some reason the TV just shuts up, and you have to turn it off and on again to get it to talk. Sometimes it just gives a high-pitched howl, which is fixed by turning it off and on again. The color gets really muddy at times, and all in all it's just an enormous piece of crap. We got it when we redid our kitchen, but I will never NEVER buy a Magnavox product again. Their slogan is "Smart. Very smart." I was dumb, very dumb to buy this without doing more checking...

Reviews.Title: wow. from great to crap
Reviews.Author: J. Vega
Reviews.Content: When i first bought it, it was great. Used it for my PC and TV watching. Sadly like most people, 2 yrs later, it started turning off and on with static lines everywhere making screeching noises at random. My warranty was over and i knew i was tricked INSTANTLY. I have had 10 yr old tv's last longer then this one. After reading other peoples review im glad im not alone. Also to those who say it works fine, just wait around til the 2-3 yr mark, it will fail.

Reviews.Title: Avoid like The Plague
Reviews.Author: Dusty Potts
Reviews.Content: I Bought this TV at Brandsmart and after only a year and four months, I'm having the same problems described by the other reviewers.  It turns on and off by itself, the picture shifts from side to side and occasionally, a loud continuous beep comes from the set and won't stop until you turn it off.  I have owned two Magnavox tube TV's in the past and they both lasted about eight years a piece.  But they clearly don't have LCD technology figured out yet.  After spending $300.00 on a lemon that lasted about a year, I feel completely duped.  I will never buy another Magnavox product again.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy.  Dies after a year.
Reviews.Author: C. Weeks
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for about 18 months, and it is now worthless.  As other reviewers have said; the speakers crackle, it shuts itself off, and occasionally emits random loud noises.  I received it as a gift, and enjoyed it for a year, but will never buy a Magnavox myself.

Reviews.Title: Worked great for a short time; Now it's going in the trash.
Reviews.Author: Bart
Reviews.Content: This tv lasted about 3 years.  Worked well and picture looked good initially, but now it literally takes 15 minutes to "warm up" or whatever it's doing and in the meantime you must listen to it screech and make loud static sounds.  It's awful. Is 3 years all you get nowadays out of a tv?  I hope not.  I'll never buy another Magnavox again.  Complete waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Screeches
Reviews.Author: MRdige
Reviews.Content: I've had this just over two years.  Up until about a month ago my biggest complaint was that a couple of channels were fuzzy.  Just like others have reported, it started screeching LOUDLY within the last month.  Two years is an unreasonable life span for a TV!

Reviews.Title: Oh my goodness, seriously?!
Reviews.Author: wemberlyw
Reviews.Content: TV was purchased two to three years ago and worked fine for about 1 1/2 years. Audio has increasingly gotten worse. Now it is always fuzzy or doesn't work at all. Occassionally makes emergency broadcast type loud horn sound then shuts off. Picture now fuzzy too. And yes, I have checked the cables several times. Given that TV was only purchased a couple years ago, I would not recommend this product and would not be likely to purchase or recommend another Magnavox television. Or, maybe this is the typical lifespan of a flatscreen television?

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Andrew "Software Engineer who likes Science F...
Reviews.Content: Same as the rest. After about a year, it started screeching and rebooting. After warming up it would be OK, but over time the warm up period got longer and longer. It now takes an hour before it settles down enough to watch a movie on the HDMI. Terrible product.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at First.....
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for 2 years now and it is starting to go out already. Its a great size and has good picture quality at first, but now 2 years in things are breaking. When i turn the TV on the picture goes in and out 4 or 5 times with static noise and loud ringing. It takes about 15 minutes to warm up before it will work normally. Many people are having this same problem if you Google this model of the TV. At this point I am no longer in warranty and Magnavox will not help, fix or replace the item. I was hoping to have this TV longer than 2 years....

Reviews.Title: Perfect TV
Reviews.Author: Edward G. Rose
Reviews.Content: OK as a owner of this TV i want to say it is the best 19 inch out there, you cant get any better then this one, inputs allow you 2 make it into anything including a great moniter. Speakers are nice and loud and it has a very attractive look. This TV blows the others away, and that is why i gave it a 5 star, you cant ask for anything more from a 19inch tv then this privides!!!I got this TV 2 hook up my ps3 and my computer 2. It handles PS3 with a very clear picture, i cant ask for better, and same with my computer, 1 player games work perfectly with it, split screen gets alittle cramped but it does not restrain you from playing at all! If you play 4 players (which i havent tryed yet) on it i have to ammagine that it will be 2 small!

Reviews.Title: Annoying sound!
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I'm "luckier" than most in that I've had this TV for about 5 years and it has been fantastic...until now. It has recently taken a turn for the worst and began the screeching and shutting off described by most others. Up until this point it has been a wonderful TV for a bedroom. The picture is great and the sound is sufficient. Im not sure how long these TVs are supposed to last,but ours has hundreds,if not thousands of hours on it. There have been many,many nights that the we fell asleep without turning it off. For me this has been a five star product right up until now. If I discover that it has lived as long as a TV of this type should,I will amend my rating.

Reviews.Title: Better to throw your money in the garbage.
Reviews.Author: John I. Cody
Reviews.Content: I have a Magnavox 19 inch TV. In the last month I thought that I was having wireless (cable) receiver problems only to find out that the problem was that the TV would come on by itself and at times the screen would just go blue. When the TV screen goes blue you cannot turn the TV off, when using the remote control you can see the power light on the TV blink but cannot turn it off.When I called the cable TV provider a technician showed up the next day and checked my router and a wireless receiver that the TV was connected to and although they did not find any problem the technician replaced both. On the second call the TV came on by itself while the cable guy was here, it was determined that the TV was faulty.I have had the TV for about three years now so I do not expect any warranty service, however I did try contacting Magnavox to see if this was a problem connected with this model. Magnavox customer service does not have an e-mail (address and now I know why) but they do have a customer service telephone number which placed me on hold for over 45 minutes it could have been longer but I hung up. I did check the Internet and found that Philips/Magnavox TV has a problem with the unit automatically coming on by itself among other things.Call me old school but I still believe that a television should last longer than 3 years.This is a very poor product with a very poor warranty supported by very poor customer service. The only reason that I'm giving this product a one is because there is no lower rating.

Reviews.Title: I think it's great
Reviews.Author: Slcbell
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for almost 5 years now.  Got it for my dorm room freshman year and now use it in my bedroom.  The picture is fine for a small TV and I've never had any of the sound problems anyone else here is talking about. I also just use it with a normal cable plug in so no box that tells me the channels.  Someone talked about an annoying grey box that pops up when channel surfing but that only comes up if you hit the info button on the remote.  Sound is fine, picture is good for such a small TV and it's lasted me years.

Reviews.Title: Nice, Consistent Quality
Reviews.Author: Mike T.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV in summer of 2007 and it has served me well for the past 5 years. I've used it for TV, a laptop dual screen, XBOX 360, and it hasn't let me down once. It's been moved dozens of times too, the packaging is great and it goes in and out of the box repeatedly without getting damaged.I was dismayed upon reading other reviews that this TV was awful- I've never gotten any of those problems and hope that I can still get a few more good years out of it.

Reviews.Title: It's worked fine so far
Reviews.Author: Emme
Reviews.Content: It's striking that all the early reviews for this TV are four or five stars, all the later ones are one star.  We bought ours two years ago (at BB for $300) and have been very happy with it.  There are some design features that could definitely be improved, as another reviewer mentioned, the info screen that comes up when you change channels is very annoying (and there's no way to delete it or make it smaller), on the other hand, the channel numbers are very small and hard to read and you can't adjust the size (as you can for captions).  Changing the settings could be more intuitive, but not much needs to be done after the initial setup. The headphone jack is in the back next to the other cable connections so you have to turn the set around to attach headphones, though it's light so not a big problem, although it could be if it was attached to the wall. Also, the metal base would be more attractive if it was black, but it's mostly unobtrusive. All in all it's been just what we wanted in a small TV with excellent resolution and decent sound.

Reviews.Title: Made loud distrubing noise, powered off
Reviews.Author: paulr_22043
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv a few years ago.  I had been happy with it until a month or so ago when it began making a loud disturbing noise and powering off.  It appears that my tv had the same problem that another reviewer had.  I would not recommend purchasing this tv.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: B. Shea "baboula penguin"
Reviews.Content: I am not into the ins and outs of HDTVs. I just want a t.v. that will work and this one does.

ProductInfo.Features:
19" Flat LCD HD TV with ATSC Qam tuner
1440 x 900 HD resolution
VGA input to connect to your PC
Compact size 360 mm width
ProductInfo.Name: Magnavox 19MF337B  19-Inch LCD HDTV
